metadata.title: CVE-2019-20444 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
HttpObjectDecoder.java in Netty before 4.1.44 allows an HTTP header thatlacks a colon, which might be interpreted as a separate header with anincorrect syntax, or might be interpreted as an "invalid fold."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.45-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.45-1').
